meanings.definition: Not capable of being imagined or understood.
meanings.sent1: The concept of time travel is unconceivable to me.
meanings.sent2: The idea of a talking dog is unconceivable in real life.
meanings.sent3: It would be unconceivable to see a fish riding a bicycle.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to juggle flaming torches was unconceivable to the audience.
meanings.sent5: The scale of the universe is truly unconceivable to our limited minds.

meanings.sent1: The magician's unconceivable tricks left the audience in awe.
meanings.sent2: The story of a ghost haunting the old mansion was unconceivable to the skeptical detective.
meanings.sent3: It seemed unconceivable that a cat could outsmart a group of dogs.
meanings.sent4: The idea of a parallel universe where time flows backward was truly unconceivable.
meanings.sent5: The sheer size of the iceberg was unconceivable until they saw it up close.
